org.jsimpledb.parse

Class ParseSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsimpledb.Session
      • org.jsimpledb.parse.ParseSession
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CliSession

    public class ParseSession
extends Session
    A Session with support for parsing Java expressions.

    • Method Detail

      • getImports

        public Set<String> getImports()
        Get currently configured Java imports.

        Each entry should of the form foo.bar.Name or foo.bar.*.

        Returns:
        configured imports

      • getFunctions

        public SortedMap<String,AbstractFunction> getFunctions()
        Get the AbstractFunctions registered with this instance.
        Returns:
        registered functions indexed by name

      • getVars

        public SortedMap<String,Value> getVars()
        Get all variables set on this instance.
        Returns:
        variables indexed by name

      • registerStandardFunctions

        public void registerStandardFunctions()
        Register the standard built-in functions such as all(), foreach(), etc.

      • registerFunction

        public void registerFunction(Class<?> cl)
        Create an instance of the specified class and register it as an AbstractFunction. as appropriate. The class must have a public constructor taking either a single ParseSession parameter or no parameters; they will be tried in that order.
        Parameters:
        cl - function class
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if cl has no suitable constructor
        IllegalArgumentException - if cl instantiation fails
        IllegalArgumentException - if cl does not subclass AbstractFunction

      • resolveClass

        public Class<?> resolveClass(String name)
        Resolve a class name against this instance's currently configured class imports.
        Parameters:
        name - class name
        Returns:
        resolved class, or null if not found

      • relativizeClassName

        public String relativizeClassName(Class<?> klass)
        Relativize the given class's name, so that it is as short as possible given the configured imports. For example, for class String this will return String, but for class ArrayList this will return java.util.ArrayList unless java.util.* has been imported.
        Parameters:
        klass - class whose name to relativize
        Returns:
        relativized class name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if klass is null

      • perform

        public boolean perform(ParseSession.Action action)
        Perform the given action within a new transaction associated with this instance.

        If action throws an Exception, it will be caught and handled by reportException() and then false returned.

        Parameters:
        action - action to perform
        Returns:
        true if action completed successfully, false if the transaction could not be created or action threw an exception
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if action is null
        IllegalStateException - if there is already an open transaction associated with this instance
